iti83:19.1_0: That is what the Buddha has heard.
iti83:2.1_0: “Mendicants, when a god is due to pass away from the realm of the gods, five warning signs appear.
iti83:2.2_0: Their flower-garlands wither; their clothes become soiled; they sweat from the armpits; their physical appearance deteriorates; and they no longer delight in their heavenly throne.
iti83:2.3_0: When the other gods know that that god is due to pass away, they wish them well in three ways:
iti83:2.4_0: ‘Sir, may you go from here to a good place!
iti83:3.1_0: When you have gone to a good place, may you be blessed with good fortune!
iti83:4.1_0: When you have been blessed with good fortune, may you become well grounded!’
iti83:5.1_0: When this was said, one of the mendicants asked the Buddha,
iti83:5.2_0: “Sir, what do the gods reckon to be going to a good place?
iti83:6.1_0: What do they reckon to be blessed with good fortune?
iti83:7.1_0: What do they reckon to become well grounded?”
iti83:8.1_0: “It is human existence, mendicant, that the gods reckon to be going to a good place.
iti83:9.1_0: When a human being gains faith in the teaching and training proclaimed by the Realized One,
iti83:9.2_0: that is what the gods reckon to be blessed with good fortune.
